intro: Neillia incisa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed neillia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by orange-yellow fruits resembling small limes. Neillia incisa is typically found in heathlands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to various growing conditions.
